meanings.definition: The process by which a bacteriophage infects a bacterial cell and integrates its DNA into the host cell's genome.
meanings.sent1: During lysogenization, the virus DNA becomes part of the bacteria's genetic material.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study lysogenization to understand how viruses can hide in bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The lysogenization of the bacteria turned it into a genetic hybrid!
meanings.sent4: The concept of lysogenization is like a genetic Trojan horse.
meanings.sent5: Lysogenization is like a sneaky genetic ninja blending into the bacterial DNA.

meanings.definition: The state of a bacterial cell that has been infected by a bacteriophage and has integrated the phage DNA into its own genome.
meanings.sent1: After lysogenization, the bacterial cell carries the viral DNA within its own genes.
meanings.sent2: The lysogenization of the cell can have long-term effects on its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The bacterial party was a hit until lysogenization crashed it!
meanings.sent4: The lysogenization of the bacterial cell was like a secret genetic alliance.
meanings.sent5: The lysogenization process is a genetic marriage between virus and bacteria.
